main event: An unidentified flying object was observed by USAF officers at Osan Air Base in South Korea on September 14, 1957.
interesting points: The object had a brilliant white light and moved erratically, hovering and then moving with the wind.
The object was initially thought to be a balloon, but a check of the weather balloon release schedule indicated the incident occurred on a different date.
Previous similar incidents had been reported by the 6th District OSI, with report numbers RSF-1-9-55-109-2-1 and RSF-1-9-55-109-2-2 from June 25, 1954.
The light from the object was determined to come from a battery-operated lamp attached to a weather balloon, which are scheduled for release at 2000r but can have local deviations from the schedule.
The reporting officer, Captain John K. Frdina, observed the same phenomenon at 2000r.
sighted object: Unidentified flying object with a brilliant white light
